strings.string: Your "My Lessons" folder is not yet configured. In order to present or edit custom lessons, you must first designate a file on your system where they can be stored. If you have already done so in a previous session, click "Open My Lessons" below to locate the file. Otherwise, click "Create My Lessons" to select a file location, or "Cancel" to simply close this dialog.

The "My Lessons" data file could not be written to the location you selected. Click "Create My Lessons" below to try again, "Open My Lessons" to open a saved data file, or "Cancel" to close this dialog.
The file you selected is not a valid "My Lessons" data file. Click "Open My Lessons" below to try again, "Create My Lessons" to make a new data file, or "Cancel" to close this dialog.
Enter a unique lesson title. Your lesson will be saved to the Lesson Menu under 'My Lessons'.
Enter a unique title for this lesson. Your lesson will be saved to the Lesson Menu under 'My Lessons'.
To save a new copy of your lesson, enter a unique title for the copy and click 'Save'. The new copy of your lesson will be saved to the Lesson Menu under 'My Lessons'
Enter a new, unique title for this lesson.
A "My Lessons" file already exists at this location. Are you sure you want to overwrite it?
Are you sure you want to delete the lesson "${lesson.title}"?\n(This change cannot be undone.)
You've made unsaved changes to this lesson. What would you like to do?
There are unsaved changes in this lesson. Are you sure you want to exit the application without saving?
You haven't created any custom lessons yet.
This action will save your annotations into a new custom lesson. How would you like to proceed?
This action will save your annotations into the current lesson or into a new custom lesson. How would you like to proceed?
Save markup to new custom lesson
Use this screen for freestyle drawing and writing exercises, or just to clear the whiteboard while focused on something else.
Adding a YouTube video is easy! Just add this screen to your lesson, and open the Edit tab to search all of YouTube.
Build a jazz band one instrument at a time by completing each sentence in this game!

The purpose of this screen is to help learn through the magic of moving pictures. In this mode, you can place uploaded animations into the screen content and then use as a visual while teaching a class. How fun!
Use this screen to compose and present text and/or an image chosen from the media library.
Use this screen to build and present a multiple choice quiz.
Use this screen to build and present an activity whose completion requires students to drag and drop items into their correct places.
Are you sure you want to delete this screen?\n(This change cannot be undone.)
